p: Artemisia annua, Pyrrosia lingua, and Lindera aggregata have been reported to possess antiviral effect against SARS-CoV ( Lau et al., 2008). Emodin from Polygonum multiflonum also inhibits the interaction between S-proteins of SARS-CoV and ACE2 receptors (the receptor the virus employs to infect host cells). Phenolic compounds from black tea (tannic acid, 3-isotheaflavin-3-gallate, and theaflavin-3,3 1-digallate) have also been reported to inhibit the chymotrypsin-like protease (3CL pro) of SARS-CoV ( Lau et al., 2008).
